Description: Papyrus bearing a Coptic text written in red ink. 34 lines written along the fibres (recto) and 37 against the fibres (verso).
Curator's comments: The text is written in Fayumic dialect. The writing is biblical majuscule.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (108779) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/108779)
Kuhn 1970 / A Coptic Jeremiah apocryphon (p. 97; pp 334-336.)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: fragmentary, fractured, insect attack, delaminating, frayed, loss Iron-gall ink (abraded) Tabbed: kraft paper Tabbed: silk Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: cloth Object Priority: B Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: C Curatorial condition comment: fair (incomplete)
